intro: Heckeldora ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's hellbore, is a rare and endangered species native to the southeastern United States. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its unique botanical features include a taproot system and a distinct, aromatic odor. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
